intro: Brachyscome basaltica var. basaltica, commonly known as the basalt daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Brachyscome basaltica var. basaltica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in dry landscapes.
